sections.heading: Database Transactions
sections.content: Use ACID transactions to ensure data consistency. Implement proper isolation levels (READ COMMITTED, SERIALIZABLE) based on use case. Handle deadlocks and implement retry logic for transient failures.

sections.heading: Kubernetes Deployments - Application Management
sections.content: Deployments manage ReplicaSets and provide declarative updates to Pods. They ensure desired number of replicas are running and handle rolling updates, rollbacks, and scaling operations seamlessly.

sections.heading: Streamlit Caching - Performance
sections.content: Use @st.cache_data to cache expensive computations and @st.cache_resource to cache global resources like database connections. This prevents re-computation on every app rerun and improves performance significantly.

sections.heading: OAuth 2.0 Implementation - Authentication
sections.content: Implement OAuth 2.0 authorization flow with proper scope management, token validation, and refresh token handling. Use PKCE for public clients and validate redirect URIs to prevent attacks.
